page.title: 15Living on a Farm
page.content: I live on a farm near Banff. We have 210 acres of land. About 170 acres are in barley, the rest is in grass and turnips. My dad works a 7 year shift. The field is in grass for 3 years, in barley for 3 years and turnips for 1 year. We feed the cattle turnips, barley and straw. My dad has 110 cows in the summer and 150 in the winter. My dad and a friend of his do contracting: they do silage, spraying, sowing, combining and baling. We start work at 7am and stop at 5pm. We have over 100 sheep on the farm. We breed Suffolk Cross lambs and sell them to Buchan Meat (a meat company). It is good fun living on a farm because there is hardly any traffic to worry about and plenty to do.
